toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1851, Westminster College (MO) is a private institution. Westminster College (MO) follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

institution.displayName: Bryn Athyn College of the New Church

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1877, Bryn Athyn College of the New Church is a private institution.

institution.footnote: School declined to have a school official verify the accuracy of the information contained in the U.S. News Main statistical survey.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Located in Sweet Briar, Virginia, Sweet Briar College is private liberal arts institution for women. Horseback riding is often a big part of student life at Sweet Briar College, which has a 100-acre riding center on campus.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1894, Warren Wilson College is a private institution. Warren Wilson College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

satAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1852, Wartburg College is a private institution. The school has 53.3% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Wartburg College is 11:1.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT may not be required by school for some or all applicants, and in reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores, or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT may not be required by school for some or all applicants, and in reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores, or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1872, Doane University is a private institution. Doane University offers a Greek system, where 22 percent of the student body is involved in a sorority and 35% is involved in a fraternity.
Founded in 1872, Lyon College is a private institution. Lyon College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered more selective.
Founded in 1835, Oglethorpe University is a private institution. The school has 58.1% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Oglethorpe University is 15:1.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1967, University of Puerto Rico--Cayey is a public institution.
Founded in 1954, University of Virginia--Wise is a public institution. University of Virginia--Wise follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: The U.S. states that hosted the most international students during the 2014-2015 academic year were California, New York and Texas.
